definition: to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to meet again after a long period of separation

sentences.english: Another proverb about love is, "Absence makes the heart grow fonder."
sentences.chinese: 另一個關於愛情的諺語是，“久別情更濃。”

sentences.english: Then they had a little celebration on finding each other.
sentences.chinese: 於是，他們先慶祝了一下久別重逢。

sentences.english: People feel especially drawn to one another when they have been reunited after many years of separation.
Having reunited after a long departure, the two certainly have a lot to talk about.
sentences.chinese: 兩人久別重逢，自有許多話說。

sentences.english: Refers to the long-awaited family and friends or brothers?
sentences.chinese: 指親友或兄弟久別重逢，在一起親切交談。

sentences.english: Reveal between the lines forward to the long-awaited home deep memory.
sentences.chinese: 字裏行間流露着對久別故鄉的深懷念。

sentences.english: They were pleased to meet after such a long separation.
sentences.chinese: 久別重逢，他們非常高興。

sentences.english: It was of course a delight for them to meet again after such a long separation.
The reunited lovers rush to a motel.
sentences.chinese: 兩個久別重逢的愛人去了汽車旅館。

definition: homeless and miserable/forced to leave home and wander from place to place/to live as a refugee
to cater to sb to make them happy (esp. of one's parents)
(literary) (of a married woman) to visit one's parents
far-flung realms as next door (idiom)/close in spirit although far away
on leaving/on the point of departure
